message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SD 

This paper proposes an extension to neural network language models, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses memory augmented networks, which are a type of neural network architecture, and draws a link between the use of external memory in neural networks and cache models used with count-based language models. This suggests that the paper could also be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper proposes a mechanism for accessing past hidden activations, which could be relevant to sub-category cs.SD (Systems and Control).
